alert.note: Alert for Foothills of the Northern Blue Mountains of Oregon; Northern Blue Mountains of Oregon (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Pendleton (Northeast Oregon and Southeast Washington)
info.headline: Hydrologic Outlook issued December 26 at 4:57AM PST by NWS Pendleton
info.description: ...MODERATE TO HEAVY RAINFALL WILL BRING RISES ON STREAMS AND RIVERS THROUGH THE MIDDLE OF THE WEEK... A strong storm will bring moderate to heavy rainfall beginning tonight and continuing through Tuesday night. Two to three inches of rain is expected over the Cascades and one to 2 inches of rain is anticipated over the Blue Mountains. This rainfall, combine with warmer temperatures will lead to higher snow levels and increased snow melt and runoff. As a result, many streams and rivers will experience in-bank rises, but at this time, no flooding is anticipated. However, if more rainfall is received than anticipated or, temperatures are warmer than expected minor flooding of streams and low lying areas could occur and there could be ponding of water on some ponding of water on roadways. Additional precipitation is anticipated Thursday and Friday, but due to colder temperatures, no additional flooding concerns are anticipated, due to the precipitation falling as snow in the mountains.

area.areaDesc: Foothills of the Northern Blue Mountains of Oregon; Northern Blue Mountains of Oregon
